title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: While writing SWT code, I type 'button.dispose'. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED and intWidgetdispose(). I then type '(' because the line I was typing was supposed to be 'button.dispose();'. But as soon as I type '(' then automatic code assist seems to insert whatever is selected.
OB: When typing 'button.dispose', code assist inserts the item 'DISPOSED' instead of 'dispose()'.
EB: When typing 'button.dispose', code assist should notice that I have typed '(', and therefore, it should insert 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'.
SR:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Start typing 'button.dispose'.
3. Observe that automatic code assist inserts 'DISPOSED' instead of 'dispose()'.
4. Type '(' after 'button.dispose'.
5. Observe that automatic code assist inserts whatever is selected.
